notes: We've a few reasons for the 6.00pm arrival time / check in / bag drop time... One of them is that we're really flexible with check out times. :) While we do work from home, we don't particularly want to broadcast on the internet if we are away from home. That's why our arrival time is always listed as 6pm. Our "check in" / "arrival time" / "bag drop" is all the same thing. It's not like we're a hotel with a team of porters waiting to take your bags any time of the day or night whether we're at home or not. So, if we haven't agreed some alternate arrangements, then we look forward to welcoming you to our home at 6.00pm. While we may be able to arrange some arrival times / bag drops / check ins earlier, we do need to make those arrangements well in advance. So if the 6.00pm check in time isn't your preference, please talk to us about it *before* you make your reservation. :)

G'Day from Australia!

He's Vinh, and I'm Stuart...

We're big fans of AirBnB for nearly a decade having used it when traveling in the USA not long after AirBnB first started.

Since then we've enjoyed traveling with AirBnB across the US, around Australia, in Hong Kong, and also in Vietnam. We're also hosts.

So here's an open invitation to come check us out.

My partner Vinh is a keen traveler who works a lot with artists and designers in his coaching practice. He's the energetic, vibrant one...

One of the things we're keen to do is catch up with some social entrepreneurs, coworkers, not for profits, and microfinanciers.

We're particularly interested social enterprise, coworking, and small business incubators & mentoring projects.

More that happy to answer any questions that you may have.

All the best,

Vinh & Stuart

I am originally Scottish but I have made Sydney my home for the last 14 years, I  love the city and the country and would not live anywhere else. I am well travelled, I enjoy seeing new things, having new experiences, challenging myself and meeting new people.
I work for myself in the corporate work, which can mean I have long days and I may not be around much Mon to Fri. I have a work hard, play hard attitude and have a varied social life, lots of different groups of friends, always doing something.   I am open minded and value peoples differences, though I hate the term, this is a GLBTQ friendly house. 
I would describe myself as a bit of a "foodie"; I cook, host dinner parties/ soirees, I eatout and I travel for food. I enjoy the finer things in life, nice surroundings, beautiful clothes/ shoes/handbags, fine wine etc. I love shopping for the unusual from markets to tucked away little shops, designer sample sales to high end boutiques. I am creative, collect contemporary art and enjoy the creative arts.  
I am a very warm host and will try to meet the needs of all guests. 
If someone wants their privacy and just to have a bed for a few nights and do their own thing that is fine. 
If someone wants to pick my brain about what to do, where to go etc that is also fine. 
If someone wants to share a glass of wine and tell me about themselves that it also fine. 
I also have a little dog, Charlie he is a 9yr old Pomeranian that I have had since he was a puppy, he can gety a little excitable but generally is friendly and very cute.  
My life's motto are "Be the best version of you" & " I can do that"

Mosman shopping centre has a village feel that makes it popular for fashion and food shoppers from all over Sydney.  There is lots of natural bush and wildlife in Mosman - the kookaburras and lorikeets are guaranteed to give you a noisy brilliant early morning dawn chorus in the summer time!  Our location is convenient for a harbour edge walk to Manly, and visiting Sydney's famous Taronga Zoo. Studio Yindi is a great base for seeing Sydney in detail. notes: STANDARD OF ACCOMMODATION We pride ourselves on providing clean, comfortable accommodation, that represents excellent value for money. If we can find places to stay that are excellent value for money then it means we can spend longer travelling for the same budget amount! If you are comfortable with comfortable but sometimes recycled furniture and Ikea style kitchen equipment, and do not expect an apartment styled ready to be published in a trendy home magazine, then you will feel very much at home. Ever since Airbnb started in 2011, both of us (both separately and together) have listed our home/s in Sydney and (formerly) in Hong Kong.  We've successfully hosted and enjoyed meeting a swag of guests in the Airbnb international community from all cultures—some whom we call friends and continue to stay in contact with. 

As Airbnb hosts, aside from covering the accommodation basics, our style is to be friendly and responsive to the needs of our guests.  Are you a first-time visitor to Sydney who's coming without a full itinerary?  We can give you the local scoop on a lot of great activities that you won't read about online or in your guide books (pottery classes? suggestions for families and kids?)  Or, for guests who already know the city or have it all figured out or "just need a place to crash", that's cool with us too.

As Airbnb guests, we've had fantastic stays with hosts in cities such as San Francisco, Istanbul and Berlin—enjoying the flexible option of the homestay which often beats the generic-faceless hotel-stay (especially when travelling solo), and also for its' much more affordable rate.  We also recognise that Airbnb hosts make excellent guests since they treat homes as if they were our own and take extra care to return everything as it was found.

When not hosting, Brendt, a Traditional Chinese Medicine doctor who also speaks Mandarin fluently, can usually be found whiling an afternoon at the beach with a book, where he's the most happy (having grown up in sunny Queensland). He also bounces to-and-from Goa, India, where he helps manage at a yoga retreat center called Samata in Arambol during the high-peak tourism season for 4-5 months of the year.  

Saysana, who works for in the Public Health not-for-profit sector, also speaks French, enjoys to be the eternal flaneur in urban cities, roaming the markets, bazaars, hopping on a bicycle, and seeking out where the next Argentine milonga may be.

name: Luxury apartment by the beach
summary: This newly renovated 2 bed unit in a great location on the edge of the South Pacfic ocean at North Bondi.  It has a new lux stone tiled bathroom and kitchen, white washed floorboards.  Surrounded by blue sea, with great restaurants and cafes right outside your door.  This top floor unit has a terrace with views and a garage.
space: This 2-bedroom beachside pad is in a perfect position in North Bondi. Sundrenched and light-filled, it has sweeping views of the South Pacific ocean and Bondi beach, as well as the distant lights of the city and Tamarama.  The apartment is designer decorated in laid-back beachside chic.  Combined living and dining enjoys dining for 4 and a lounge area with 42” LED screen, Blueray, DVD, sound system (bring iPod or CDs) and cable television.    Enjoy programmes in HD and even 3D. There is a high speed wi-fi connection as well. The main bedroom has a Queen size bed while the second bedroom has a double, both with high quality white linens.  Both bedrooms enjoy ocean views. The balcony offers undercover dining for 6 people.  This is a walk-up building, and the unit is on the 3rd floor.  If you are reasonably active you won't even notice the stairs.  However it may not be suitable for the elderly. Enjoy living like a local and the best of Bondi from this Sydney greatspace.

neighborhood_overview: This is the best street in North Bondi, in the Ben Buckler enclave on the edge of the deep blue Pacific Ocean. Out the front door it is a 2-minute walk to the North Bondi village, with great cafes, cool little neighbourhood restaurants and local shops.  Meander another 2 minutes and you are on the sand of Bondi beach.  On the way, stop for a glass of wine and a plate of calamari at trendy North Bondi Fish.  Or pop upstairs for a schooner of beer and the best views of Bondi Beach at the laid back RSL Club, where travellers are always welcome.
notes: There is some construction on the street from a house being built.
transit: Lock up garage on the property or the bus terminus to the city is 100 metres away.
interaction: Questions by phone or email
house_rules: No pets and no smoking in house.  No parties.

host_about: I love the North Bondi lifestyle - my tip is to try and get out there at sunrise to tap into the local life, go for a surf or run the iconic coastal path to Bronte past Icebergs sea baths or just grab a coffee and chill on the legendary sands before they heat up with sun and sun worshippers.  Don't forget your bathers. THE BEST start to a day in Sydney.
